c74object.name: cage.chroma.tocentroid
c74object.digest: Find tonal centroid of a chroma vector
c74object.description: Computes the tonal centroid transform of a chroma vector.

objarg.name: projection_radii
objarg.description: Sets the initial projection radii (see list method). Default is 1 1 1.

method.name: bang
method.description: Output the result obtained from the most recently received input data.

method.name: list
method.description: A list in the right inlet should contain three floats, corresponding to the three projections radii (see llll method), respectively for: fifths, minor thirds and major thirds. Default is 1, for each space. A common choice is also setting 0.5 just for minor thirds.

method.name: llll
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is expected to be the chroma vector whose tonal centroid must be computed, computes such centroid and outputs it.
An llll in the second inlet is converted into a list, setting the projection radii (see list).

c74object.discussion: The tonal centroid transform is computed in a similar way as Harte and Sandler do in http://www.ofai.at/~martin.gasser/papers/oefai-tr-2006-13.pdf Essentially, the chroma vector is projected into three spaces: one generated by fifths, one generated by minor thirds, and one generated by major thirds.
